text: The History of Economics Society (HES) is a learned society in the field of the history of economics and economic methodology, which was formally established in May 1974. Since its creation, the HES has served an international community. The HES publishes a quarterly peer-reviewed academic journal that began in 1979 as the History of Economics Bulletin and was renamed the Journal of the History of Economic Thought in 1990. The HES also offers several grants for researchers working on the history of economics such as the and the In addition, the HES offers online resources for historians and general information on the history of economics community, including graduate programs and course materials.
